lead_paragraph: Daunte Culpepper, a former Pro Bowl quarterback, was released by Miami yesterday. The Dolphins tried unsuccessfully for weeks to trade Culpepper. The move came a day before a breach-of-contract grievance — filed by the N.F.L. Players Association on Culpepper’s behalf — was scheduled to be heard. Culpepper, 30, became expendable six weeks ago, when the Dolphins made a trade with Kansas City for Trent Green, who will be Miami’s starter entering this season.
